Name: chronic leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that develops slowly.

Name: lymphocytic leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that has_material_basis_in lymphoblasts (immature white blood cells).

Name: chronic erythremia
Definition: A leprosy that is an early form of the disease which causes one to a few hypopigmented or erythematous macules.

Name: acute leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that occurs when a hematopoietic stem cell undergoes malignant transformation into a primitive

Name: obsolete secondary malignant neoplasm of suprarenal gland
Definition: A leukemia that occurs when a hematopoietic stem cell undergoes malignant transformation into a primitive
Synonym: secondary malignant neoplasm of adrenal gland (disorder)

Name: obsolete metastasis to adrenals
Definition: A leukemia that occurs when a hematopoietic stem cell undergoes malignant transformation into a primitive

Name: obsolete staphylococcal pneumonia
Definition: A staphylococcal infectious disease that is caused due to the infection by Gram-positive bacterium Staphylococcus aureus

Name: obsolete AIDS-related pelvic inflammatory disease
Definition: A staphylococcal infectious disease that is caused due to the infection by Gram-positive bacterium Staphylococcus aureus

Name: obsolete adrenal hemorrhage of fetus or newborn
Definition: A staphylococcal infectious disease that is caused due to the infection by Gram-positive bacterium Staphylococcus aureus

Name: obsolete gastrointestinal hemorrhage of fetus or newborn
Definition: A staphylococcal infectious disease that is caused due to the infection by Gram-positive bacterium Staphylococcus aureus

Name: obsolete cervicofacial actinomycosis
Definition: An actinomycosis that involves invasion and infiltration located_in head and located_in neck

Name: obsolete cerebral actinomycosis
Definition: An actinomycosis that involves invasion and infiltration located_in brain

Name: subleukemic leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that is characterized by the presence of abnormal white blood cells located_in peripheral blood

Name: subacute leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that is in between acute and chronic leukemia and is characterized by a moderate duration or severity.

Name: aleukemic leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that arises from changes in the tissues forming white blood cells and characterized by a normal or decreased number of white blood cells in the circulating blood.

Name: obsolete mediastinum embryonal carcinoma
Definition: A leukemia that arises from changes in the tissues forming white blood cells and characterized by a normal or decreased number of white blood cells in the circulating blood.

Name: obsolete mediastinal germ cell cancer
Definition: A leukemia that arises from changes in the tissues forming white blood cells and characterized by a normal or decreased number of white blood cells in the circulating blood.

Name: childhood leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that occurs in children.

Name: myeloid leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that is located_in myeloid tissue.

Name: megakaryocytic leukemia
Definition: A leukemia that derives from blood-forming tissue in which megakaryocytes proliferate in the bone marrow and circulate in the blood in large numbers.

Name: obsolete Herpes simplex virus otitis externa
Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results_in inflammation located_in external ear

Name: obsolete Herpes simplex virus septicemia
Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results in inflammatory response by the immune system of the body to Human herpesvirus 1 or Human herpesvirus 2 in the blood

Name: obsolete lymphosarcoma involving intra-abdominal lymph nodes
Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results in inflammatory response by the immune system of the body to Human herpesvirus 1 or Human herpesvirus 2 in the blood

Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results in inflammatory response by the immune system of the body to Human herpesvirus 1 or Human herpesvirus 2 in the blood

Name: obsolete nodular lymphoma involving spleen
Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results in inflammatory response by the immune system of the body to Human herpesvirus 1 or Human herpesvirus 2 in the blood

Name: obsolete malignant histiocytosis involving lymph nodes of inguinal region and lower limb
Definition: A Simplexvirus infectious disease that results in inflammatory response by the immune system of the body to Human herpesvirus 1 or Human herpesvirus 2 in the blood
